original_title: Sri Lanka to make presentation to creditors on IMF deal on March 30
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka will make a presentation to creditors after the International Monetary Fund approved a four year reform program, the Finance Ministry said.

The presentation will be chaired by the Governor of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL), Nandalal Weerasinghe and the Secretary to the Treasury and Ministry of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies, K M Mahinda Siriwardana.
“Sri Lanka is fully committed to successfully completing its IMF program,” the statement said.

“The Sri Lankan Government has embarked on an ambitious reform agenda to ensure fiscal consolidation, boost tax revenues, rebuild its foreign reserves, improve economic governance, and strengthen the Central Bank’s independence.

“Sri Lanka will continue to engage with all its creditors in good faith with full transparency and looks forward to constructive discussions for a swift resolution of the public debt situation.” (Colombo/Mar26/2023)
